deal.dealdescription: Deal Of The Day Main Top Left Section

deal.title: A new space
deal.description: <p> A new space - dont miss it</p>

deal.title: Dance Ireland
deal.description: <p> Dance Ireland is the representative body for professional dance in Ireland. We celebrate, develop and promote the diversity of dance practices in Ireland today by presenting a professional training and development programme and by providing practical supports and services for dance artists. With DanceHouse we provide a working home for dance. We are committed to providing initiatives in Dublin, countrywide and internationally. </p>

deal.title: Glasnevin Museum
deal.description: <p> Glasnevin Museum features a fully interactive exhibition highlighting the history of the Victorian Garden Cemetary and the lives of those buried there.</p>

product.title: Vicar Street
product.address: 58 Thomas Street, DUBLIN 2, Ireland
product.description: Dublin venue Vicar Street topped the Awards, scooping three gongs: Best National Live Music Venue of the Year and Best Dublin Live Music Venue of the Year, along with a Hot Press Readers Award for Best Live Music Venue in Ireland.

product.title: The Wright Venue
product.address: South Quarter, Airside Retail Park, Swords, Co. Dublin, Ireland
product.description: The Wright Venue is one of those places that invites superlatives. It\'s been designed on a jaw-dropping-ly large scale, incorporating a substantial main club, a terrace bar, a members-only penthouse club, the laid-back and mature purple room with 70s and 80s vibes, plus the cities luxurious private hire booths with plasma screens, gaming consoles and pre-stocked fridges. In other words, the people behind the Wright Venue havent just attempted to match the superclubs
product.webcontent: With the spirit of a nightclub and the energy of a live music venue this room is a haven for music & dance.

product.address: 6/7 Finglas Road, 7, Co. Dublin City, Ireland

product.webcontent: The Gardens are 19.5 hectares. Visitors can see an arboretum, rock garden, large pond, herbaceous borders and an annual display of plants including Victorian carpet bedding.

product.address: 1 Upper Gardiner Street, DUBLIN 1, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: Mountjoy Square, one of five Georgian squares in Dublin, Ireland, lies on the north side of the city just under a kilometre from the River Liffey.
product.webcontent: Mountjoy Square, one of five Georgian squares in Dublin, Ireland, lies on the north side of the city just under a kilometre from the River Liffey.

product.webcontent: The park iis thirty-two acres in extent and, apart from the pond and many attractive tree and flower-lined walkways, is home to a number of recreational activities.

product.webcontent: Bushy Park House was originally owned by Arthur Bushe of Dangan, County Kilkenny, Secretary to the Revenue Commissioners who built the house, originally known as Bushes House in 1700 on a site of four hectares.

product.title: Four Season Hotel Dublin
product.description: Ireland top 5star hotel
product.webcontent: Ireland top 5star hotel

product.title: Dublin City Hall
product.address: Dame Street, DUBLIN 2, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: The building was restored to its eighteenth-century appearance at the beginning of the twenty-first century, and Dublin City Council has won awards for the conservation of this historic building.
product.webcontent: The building was restored to its eighteenth-century appearance at the beginning of the twenty-first century, and Dublin City Council has won awards for the conservation of this historic building.

product.title: Old Jameson Distillery
product.address: Bow Street , Smithfield , Dublin 7
product.description: A visit to the Jameson Distillery is an experience that will transport you back in time to the days when one of Irelands greatest entrepreneurs, John Jameson, first made the whiskey that is his legacy today. Offering Guided tours , 7 days a week , Tutored Whiskey tasting , Exclusive Gift shop , Restaurant and Bars .
product.webcontent: Jameson is a single-distillery Irish whiskey. The brand is today owned by the French beverage conglomerate Pernod Ricard.

product.title: The Guinness Storehouse
product.address: 121 James's St Dublin 8, Co. Dublin
product.description: The Guinness Storehouse is located in the heart of the St. Jamess Gate Brewery in Dublin, and is, according to the Guinness Storehouse Web site, Irelands No. 1 international visitor attraction.
product.webcontent: The Guinness Storehouse is located in the heart of the St. Jamess Gate Brewery in Dublin, and is, according to the Guinness Storehouse Web site, Irelands No. 1 international visitor attraction.

product.title: Kilmainham Gaol
product.address: 8 Inchicore Road, DUBLIN 8, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: Kilmainham Gaol has played an important part in Irish history, as many leaders of Irish rebellions were imprisioned and some executed in the jail by the British.
product.webcontent: Kilmainham Gaol has played an important part in Irish history, as many leaders of Irish rebellions were imprisioned and some executed in the jail by the British.

product.title: National Library of Ireland
product.address: 2 Kildare Street, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: The National Library of Ireland (Irish: Leabharlann Nisinta na hireann) is a national library located in Dublin, Ireland, in a building designed by Thomas Newenham Deane.
product.webcontent: The National Library of Ireland (Irish: Leabharlann Nisinta na hireann) is a national library located in Dublin, Ireland, in a building designed by Thomas Newenham Deane.

product.title: National Wax Museum Plus
product.address: Foster Place, Temple Bar Dublin 2
product.description: Enjoy an experience of sight, sound and entertainment The National Wax Museum Plus is an exciting interactive visitor attraction located in the heart of Dublin\'s city centre Temple Bar district and just off Dame Street. The museum is housed over four floors and 13,000 square feet in a historic Foster Place landmark building, previously the home for Ireland\'s gold store and arms at the turn of the last century! The museum is an outstandingly original visitor attraction and has been designed
product.webcontent: On October 7, 2009, the museum re-opened following extensive renovation at its new location in the left flank of the Irish Houses of Parliament, at Foster Place.

product.title: Old Jameston destillery
product.address: 7 Bow Street, DUBLIN 7, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: Jameson Irish whiskey is produced from a mixture of malted and unmalted or green Irish barley.
product.webcontent: <p> Jameson Irish whiskey is produced from a mixture of malted and unmalted or green Irish barley.</p>

product.title: Government Buildings
product.address: Upper Merrion Street 24, 2, Co. Ireland, Ireland
product.description: Government Buildings (Irish: Tithe an Rialtais) is a large Edwardian building enclosing a quadrangle on Merrion Street in Dublin, Ireland, in which several key offices of the government of Ireland are located.
product.webcontent: Government Buildings (Irish: Tithe an Rialtais) is a large Edwardian building enclosing a quadrangle on Merrion Street in Dublin, Ireland, in which several key offices of the government of Ireland are located.

product.title: Dublin Writers Museum
product.address: 19 Parnell Square North, DUBLIN 1, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: Dublin is famous as a city of writers and literature, and the Dublin Writers Museum is an essential visit for anyone who wants to discover, explore, or simply enjoy Dublins immense literary heritage.
product.webcontent: Dublin is famous as a city of writers and literature, and the Dublin Writers Museum is an essential visit for anyone who wants to discover, explore, or simply enjoy Dublins immense literary heritage.

product.title: Trinity College Dublin
product.address: College Street, DUBLIN 2, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: The Library of Trinity College is a legal deposit library for Ireland and the United Kingdom, containing over 4.5 million printed volumes and significant quantities of manuscripts (including the Book of Kells), maps and music.
product.webcontent: The Library of Trinity College is a legal deposit library for Ireland and the United Kingdom, containing over 4.5 million printed volumes and significant quantities of manuscripts (including the Book of Kells), maps and music.

product.title: St Audoens Church
product.address: High Street, DUBLIN 8, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: St. Audoens has the distinction of being the only medieval parish church, retaining any original features, still in use within the city of Dublin.
product.webcontent: St. Audoens has the distinction of being the only medieval parish church, retaining any original features, still in use within the city of Dublin.

product.title: Gaiety Theatre
product.address: King Street South, DUBLIN 2, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: For 138 years The Gaiety Theatre has given the people of Dublin opera, musicals, drama, revues, comedy, concerts, dance, festivals and pantomime.
product.webcontent: <p> For 138 years The Gaiety Theatre has given the people of Dublin opera, musicals, drama, revues, comedy, concerts, dance, festivals and pantomime.</p>

product.title: Abbey Theatre
product.address: 26 Lower Abbey Street, DUBLIN 1, Co. Dublin, Ireland
product.description: The Abbey first opened its doors to the public on 27 December 1904, despite losing its original building to a fire in 1951, it has remained active to the present day.
product.webcontent: <p> The Abbey first opened its doors to the public on 27 December 1904, despite losing its original building to a fire in 1951, it has remained active to the present day.</p>

product.title: Bewleys Cafe Theatre

product.description: Bewleys Cafe Theatre is Irelands only permanent venue for lunchtime drama offering a unique theatrical experience.
product.webcontent: Bewleys Cafe Theatre is Irelands only permanent venue for lunchtime drama offering a unique theatrical experience.

product.title: Project Art Gallery
product.address: 39 Essex Street East, DUBLIN 2, Co. Dublin City, Ireland
product.description: With an extensive programme covering everything from visual arts to dance, music and theatre, there is plenty to fuel the imagination from an exciting year-round programme.
product.webcontent: With an extensive programme covering everything from visual arts to dance, music and theatre, there is plenty to fuel the imagination from an exciting year-round programme.

product.title: The Olympia Theatre

product.description: One of Dublins most famous venues, the Olympia is as versed at hosting rock concerts as it is to hosting dramatic works of the finest quality.
product.webcontent: One of Dublins most famous venues, the Olympia is as versed at hosting rock concerts as it is to hosting dramatic works of the finest quality.
